provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1799; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold from his collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 97 (with lot 96, *The Church and Christ*, Butlin 432, for 10s.); possibly Sir William Stirling-Maxwell or "Mr. Golding," both collectors; possibly John Clark Strange by 1863; Samuel Prince, sold from his collection, Sotheby's, 11 Dec. 1865, lot 281, with *Christ Blessing the Little Children*, Butlin 419 (£12.5s. to "Hayes," probably a dealer); Alfred Aspland by 1876; sold from his collection, Sotheby's, 27 Jan. 1885, lot 92 (£10 to "Gray," probably a dealer); J. Annan Bryce, sold 1904 to W. Graham Robertson; sold from his collection, Christie's, 22 July 1949, lot 26 (£472.10s. to Thomas Agnew & Sons acting for George Goyder); by inheritance to Goyder's heirs in 1997; sold Christie's, 8 July 2008, lot 22 (£115,250 to John Windle acting for Robert N. Essick).

objnote.p: Blake signed the work with his monogram, lower right, and dated it; see the textual transcription. The painting has been restored three times: between 1863 and 1880, between 1904 and 1907 (probably by Stanley William Littlejohn), and by John Hell c. 1950.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The scene represents Mary, Joseph, and Jesus on their flight into Egypt (Matthew 2:13-14) from King Herod's injunction that all infant males be killed. This is a night scene, further darkened by pigment decay over the years. At the center of the Virgin Mary rides side-saddle on a donkey. The animal faces left and has its head down and its front, front left leg raised. Mary sits, facing forward, wearing a gown and a veil covering her hair. She has a halo above her head. Her knees are bent, as are her arms. A crescent moon appears above and to the left of the Virgin's head. She holds the infant Jesus on her lap. Jesus sits on Mary's lap, with his head facing forward and his body facing left. He appears to be gowned or swaddled. He may have a halo, or may just be lit with an aura. Around Mary's head hover or fly six nude putti (cherubs or infant wingless angels). On the left, the topmost is seen from behind with its arms raised horizontally and its legs extended backward slightly, left leg bent. The middle putto on the left has its arms folded over its chest and both legs bent. The lowermost putto on the left looks back, mouth open, at Mary; it may have long hair or a veil over its head. The topmost putto on the right looks to the right and has its right arm raised at 135 degrees, perhaps pointing with its right hand up and to the left. Its right leg and left arm are bent, but its left leg is extended backward. The middle putto on the right may have its legs extended backward and its arms folded over its chest. The lowermost putto on the right has its knees and arms bent, and may hold its left hand to its mouth or both hands together in prayer. To the right of the donkey hovers or flies a winged male angel with short hair. He is seen from behind with his head turned in right profile. He appears to be gowned; his right foot is pictured. The head of another angel, looking forward and right, appears to the left of the frontmost angel. To the left of the donkey stand two figures, both gowned and facing forward, but turning their heads to the right to look at Mary. The figure to the right has a beard and is probably Joseph. His right arm appears to be bent upward under his garment; his left arm may be down and bent slightly across his body. The figure on the left is probably an angel whose large wings back both figures. His right arm is at his side.

component.illusobjdesc: This is a night scene, further darkened by pigment decay over the years.
A crescent moon appears above and to the left of the Virgin Mary's head.
The Virgin Mary rides an ass or donkey. The animal faces left and has its head down and its front left leg raised. Its hooves are clearly pictured.

The Virgin Mary rides side-saddle on a donkey. Mary sits, facing forward, wearing a gown and a veil (or scarf or cloth of some sort) covering her hair. She has a halo above her head. Her knees are bent, as are her arms. She holds th infant Jesus on her lap.

Jesus sits on Mary's lap, with his head facing forward and his body facing left. He appears to be gowned or swaddled, possibly with a veil, scarf, or cloth of some sort over his head. He may have a halo, or may just be lit with an aura.

Around Mary's head hover or fly six nude putti (cherubs or infant wingless angels). On the left, the topmost is seen from behind with its arms raised horizontally and its legs extended backward slightly, left leg bent. The middle putto on the left has its arms folded over its chest and both legs bent. The lowermost putto on the left looks back, mouth open, at Mary; it may have long hair or a veil over its head. The topmost putto on the right looks to the right and has its right arm raised at 135 degrees, perhaps pointing with its right hand up and to the left. Its right leg and left arm are bent, but its left leg is extended backward. The middle putto on the right may have its legs extended backward and its arms folded over its chest. The lowermost putto on the right has its knees and arms bent, and may hold its left hand to its mouth or both hands together in prayer.

To the right of the donkey hovers or flies a male angel with short hair. His enormous left wing arches over Mary's head. He is seen from behind with his head turned in right profile. He appears to be gowned; his right foot is pictured. The head of another angel, looking forward and right, appears to the left of the frontmost angel.

To the left of the donkey stand two figures, both gowned and facing forward, but turning their heads to the right to look at Mary. The figure to the right has a beard and is probably Joseph. His right arm appears to be bent upward under his garment; his left arm may be down and bent slightly across his body. The figure on the left is probably an angel whose large wings back both figures. His right arm is at his side.
